description: Test to check the behaviour of a Server that tries to connect with itself thinking it is a remote server.
The expected behaviour is to nothing happens, the Server will acked itself and its change is already in the Database.
Server B connects with Server A. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration
Server A connects with Server B. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration
It requires more time than usual in order to announce Server A DATA(P) and receive it and reply in B
Server B connects with Server A. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration
Server A connects with Server B. Server B leaves. Server B turns back with same configuration
Server B connects with server A. Server B leaves. Server B start again. Server A leaves, Server A start again
Both Servers should know every information from the other before leaving and after restarting
t = 0  : A1 starts & B1 starts
t = 2  : A1 snapshot
t = 3  : B1 snapshot & B1 finish
t = 7  : A1 snapshot
t = 8  : B2 starts
t = 12 : B2 snapshot
t = 13 : A1 snapshot & A1 finish
t = 17 : B2 snapshot
t = 18 : A2 starts
t = 22 : A2 snapshot
t = 23 : B2 snapshot & B2 finish
t = 27 : A2 snapshot & A2 finish
Client connects with Server. Server leaves. Server turns back with same configuration.
Test to check the consequences of modifying the file referenced by FASTDDS_ENVIRONMENT_FILE on the
Discovery Server behaviour. SERVER and SIMPLE participants will change their discovery information
aligned with the changes introduced in the environment file
Test that when a process stops, all DATA(Up) of all Participants in it are sent
